intro: Solanum nannodes, commonly known as the small-flowered nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features alternate, ovate leaves with a hairy surface. Its flowers are small, usually white or pale blue, and are clustered in umbels. The fruit is a globose berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
